definition: to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
divinatory diagram/one of the eight divinatory trigrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]/one of the sixty-four divinatory hexagrams of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
lit. to hang up a plate/to open up for business/listed (on stock market)
to suspend/to hang/(vehicle) suspension
to worry about/to be concerned about
lit. to hang upside down/fig. topsy-turvy and inequitable, e.g. manufacturing and trading costs exceed the sale price (of some goods)/to borrow more than one can ever repay
to hang up (a phone)
to register (at a hospital etc)/to send by registered mail
to be affiliated with/to operate under the wing of/affiliation
temporary assignment to a Chinese government or CCP post
to report the loss of something
to be in command/(fig.) to dominate over other considerations/to be given overemphasis
wall calendar
trailer
concerned
not wearing one thread (idiom); absolutely naked/without a stitch of clothing/in one's birthday suit
wall hanging

sentences.english: The printing part adopts hanging plate roller, which could shorten the time of plate lock-up.
sentences.chinese: 印刷部採用掛版式版輥，可縮短裝版時間。

sentences.english: A large-scale painting, usually on a wall or ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 一般掛正在牆上或天花板上的巨幅畫。

sentences.english: Summer have Cool wind, if not things to hang my heart, and is a good time in life.
sentences.chinese: 夏有涼風，若無閒事掛心頭，並是人生好時節。

sentences.english: Plan of IFB, Auction, Listing for project land.
Most historians peg the first celebration of Christmas to Rome in 336 AD.
sentences.chinese: 大部分歷史學家掛聖誕慶祝羅馬首次在公元336。

sentences.english: The earthen pot is glazed inside.
I have to hang up now.
Why are Rainbows not all Over the Sky?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不見虹霓滿天掛？

sentences.english: But he tried to appear calm as he instructed Griffith to put the car in neutral.
There is a price-list hanging on one of the walls which is removed in case of an inspection.
sentences.chinese: 一面牆上掛有價目表，在有人來檢查時，就會取下來。

sentences.english: Brow tip celebrating smiling expression hanging.
The iron rod supports the valance is bent in an arc.
sentences.chinese: 掛窗簾上部短幔的鐵棍彎成了個弓形。

sentences.english: He took off his hat and shawl and went to the rack to hang them up .
sentences.chinese: 他脫去帽子和圍巾，走到掛鉤前，要把它們掛起來。

sentences.english: For the first time, sales teams were paid according to their contributions to gross profit.
sentences.chinese: 銷售團隊的薪酬第一次跟其對毛利潤的貢獻掛上鉤。

sentences.english: I had just fastened our pinafores together, and hung them up for a curtain, when in comes Joseph, on an errand from the stables.
sentences.chinese: 我把我們的圍裙系在一起，掛起來當窗簾用。

sentences.english: They drilled a hole on the wall to hang a picture.
sentences.chinese: 他們在這面牆上衝眼是爲了在上面掛一幅畫。
